ygData.subject: More weaving spiders
ygData.msgSnippet: Okay, so last night I decided that pressing my nose against the screen reading the messages while trying to weave four songs wasn t stressful enough (with the
ygData.messageBody:
Okay, so last night I decided that pressing my nose against the screen
reading the messages while trying to weave four songs wasn't stressful
enough (with the first two being DoTs there should always be some DoT effect
while you are getting benefit from the other two) I decided to try using the
instruments for each. My setup:

lute hanging on the cursor.

---------- ----------
| drum | | horn |
---------- ----------

---------- ----------
| DDD | | CoD |
---------- ----------

---------- ----------
| Largo | | PRyth |
---------- ----------

(graphic copyright 2000 Sylly Songsynger)

and here is what I did:

(horn) DDD
(swap horn/lute) CoP
Largos M. Binding(swap horn/drum)
(swap Drum/Lute) Purifying Rhythms(swap Lute/Horn)
(swap drum/horn)

Yeesh, but it worked great, gotta love having 68 poison resist when fighting
crag spiders. I never had to run, although people kept running by and
buffing me so I never got an exact idea of how it worked over time. And this
is on a Pentium 233 with a 56K connection, yes there were gaps between the
songs, but once I found the groove they were less frequent and pretty small.


Tszaaz E'Taurguin
(btw, the last name means "Of The Undead Forest" in Elvish for Kithicor,
where Tszaaz was born. Running through Kithicor last night I was laughing
about all the time I spent there looking really hard for some hidden,
unknown story/danger I could tie into Tszaaz's backstory. Sheesh, running
the zone edge is filled with unknown danger these days).
